lead_paragraph: Just two weeks after undergoing surgery for a herniated desk, the baritone Mariusz Kwiecien will return to the stage in the title role of "Don Giovanni" at the Metropolitan Opera on Oct. 25, the company said on Friday. Mr. Kwiecien, his surgeon and manager reported in a conference call that "his recovery is progressing at a remarkable pace," Peter Clark, the Met spokesman, wrote in an e-mail. He is expected to carry out all the stage action, with the possible exception of climbing down a ladder in the opening scene, Mr. Clark said. Mr. Kwiecien felt pain during the dress rehearsal last week and had to withdraw from early performances in the run. Doctors operated on his back on Tuesday.

headline.main: Mariusz Kwiecien Set to Return to Met Stage
